entries.title: What a shutdown would mean for the Department of Homeland Security, which includes not only border agents but also airport security officers and emergency management functions
The Justice Department released what it says is its final trove of files related to the late Jeffrey Epstein. Here are some takeaways on what we know so far.
Republican Sen. Rand Paul joined Democrats in grilling top DHS officials about the department’s handling of President Trump’s immigration agenda. Read more in today’s WSJ Politics Newsletter:
The Pentagon is sending the Navy’s largest and most advanced aircraft carrier to the Middle East, as the U.S. steps up plans for a potential attack on Iran, two U.S. officials said
Firing a Coast Guard pilot for leaving Kristi Noem’s blanket behind. Berating staff when she’s not on TV enough. Inside the chaos at DHS.
Chris Klomp, the head of Medicare and a former healthcare executive, will take on a new role as Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s No. 2 in a HHS shake-up ahead of the midterms
Border czar Tom Homan said the Trump administration is ending the immigration crackdown in Minnesota, an enforcement surge that resulted in the shooting deaths of two American citizens
The Department of Homeland Security is facing a shutdown after Senate Democrats voted to block its funding, saying talks with the GOP to add limits on immigration enforcement hadn’t advanced enough
Justice Department’s Antitrust Chief Leaves Post After Clashes With Leadership
President Trump lashed out at GOP Gov. Kevin Stitt of Oklahoma, lobbing his latest criticism of a fellow Republican
The GOP-led House passed a resolution designed to roll back President Trump’s tariffs on Canada, as six Republicans joined Democrats in rebuking the administration’s signature economic policy
The Republican-led House passed legislation that would tighten federal voter registration requirements, advancing one of the party’s longstanding election priorities over the objections of Democrats
Unsealed document shows role Kurt Olsen, hired by the White House to investigation election fraud claims, played in spurring search of Georgia office.
President Trump’s effort to push Republican state lawmakers to create more GOP-favorable House districts is on track to yield far fewer gains than expected
President Trump made gains in 2024 with Latinos, a demographic that historically has voted for Democrats, but the economy and deportations are a headwind in the midterms
Five reasons Republicans are worried about this Texas state Senate race
When Customs and Border Protection fired a laser thinking it was aiming at cartel drones, leading the FAA to close the airspace over El Paso—and causing an uproar in Washington
The highly classified whistleblower complaint against Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard is related to an intercepted conversation in which two foreign nationals discussed Jared Kushner
Josh Gruenbaum’s brash ways as a federal agency bean-counter earned him the trust of Jared Kushner and Trump’s foreign policy team—and sparked an inquiry into whether he broke contracting rules
The Pentagon has told a second aircraft carrier strike group to prepare to deploy to the Middle East as the U.S. military prepares for a potential attack on Iran, according to three U.S. officials
The Pentagon has warned defense contractors to brace for sweeping performance reviews that will identify companies it says aren’t fulfilling their contracts
